description: Supported a health-tech platform by redesigning multi-state immunization upload flows, documenting state registry APIs, and building a prioritization framework that guided go-to-market outreach.
responsibilities: Redesigned and prototyped a multi-state immunization record upload interface in Figma to improve usability and reduce input errors.
Reviewed and documented 50 U.S. state immunization registry APIs, classifying authentication methods, messaging standards, and integration complexity on a 1–5 scale.
Built an integration readiness matrix to help sales prioritize high-opportunity states and sequence partnership outreach.
achievements: Increased immunization record accessibility by 35% and reduced user error rates by 28% via the redesigned upload interface.
Identified 8 high-opportunity states through the readiness matrix, directly informing the partnership plan.

description: Supported corporate finance reporting, competitor analysis, and workflow automation for leadership insights.
responsibilities: Analyzed balance sheets, income statements, and other reports to produce executive summaries for senior leadership.
Collaborated with a 4-person team to review competitor financials and compile an industry outlook for the EMEA region.
Automated recurring reconciliation and reporting workflows in Flexcube to improve speed and reliability.
achievements: Automated 4 key reporting workflows, increasing processing speed by 25% and saving ~10 hours/month.
Produced 10+ executive-ready report summaries and an EMEA market growth brief for the CIO.

description: Worked across ecosystem operations, investor relations support, and program benchmarking to strengthen accelerator offerings.
responsibilities: Coordinated logistics for NICL’s capstone Investor Summit with 10 startups pitching to 50 investors.
Assessed startup needs and tracked mentorship structures across 5 global accelerators to refine NICL’s Foundry Program.
Benchmarked services and investor-training curricula against 7 global programs and proposed enhancements.
achievements: Ensured seamless Investor Summit execution and facilitated investor-startup connections.
Delivered benchmarking recommendations to align the Foundry Program with international best practices.

description: Campus involvement focused on cultural programming, event logistics, and community engagement.
responsibilities: Co-organized a major cultural celebration (350+ attendees), coordinating speakers and on-site operations.
Developed a cross-channel engagement campaign across social and campus platforms to boost reach and retention.
achievements: Increased event attendance by 47% and improved retention by 38% through targeted engagement initiatives.
